org.threadly.load

Class AbstractScriptBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.load.AbstractScriptBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParallelScriptBuilder, SequentialScriptBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractScriptBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides the shared implementation among all execution step builders. This also defines the minimum API set that all builders must implement.

    • Method Detail

      • addProgressFuture

        public org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<java.lang.Double> addProgressFuture()
        Adds a step in the current test position which will log out the percent of completion for the entire test script. The provided future will complete once the test has reached this point in the script. The resulting double provided by the future is the percent of completion at this moment. You can easily log this by adding a FutureCallback to the returned future. If there are steps running in parallel at the time of execution for this progress future it should be noted the number is a best guess, as no locking occurs during determining the current progress. If the script is stopped (likely due to an error or step failure), this returned future will complete in an error state (ie Future.get() will throw a ExecutionException.
        Returns:
        A future which provide a double representing the percent of how much of the script has completed

      • setMaxScriptStepRate

        public void setMaxScriptStepRate(double stepsPerSecondLimit)
        Sets a new limit for the script steps to be executed at. This will only take place for steps which execute AFTER this point in the script. This is effectively adding a task at this point in the script that will set an limit on how fast the steps can run. If you want your entire script to adher to this limit it must be done before any steps are added. This allows you to control request rates, allowing you at run time to adjust the rate at which executions are occurring. Provide a value of zero to disable this and allow steps to execute as fast as possible.
        Parameters:
        stepsPerSecondLimit - Steps per second allowed to execute

      • hasSteps

        public abstract boolean hasSteps()
        Checks if the builder has had at least one step added to it. If this returns false then this builder is effectively a no-op.
        Returns:
        true if at least one step is attached to this builder

      • addStep

        public abstract void addStep(ScriptStep step)
        Add a step to this builder. For more specific step addition descriptions please see: SequentialScriptBuilder.addStep(ScriptStep) and ParallelScriptBuilder.addStep(ScriptStep).
        Parameters:
        step - Test step to add to builder

      • addSteps

        public abstract void addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder sequentialSteps)
        Add a sequential series of steps to this builder. Since the behavior of this depends on the current step, please see a more specific step addition behavior descriptions here: SequentialScriptBuilder.addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder) and ParallelScriptBuilder.addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder).
        Parameters:
        sequentialSteps - Script steps to be added to this builder

      • addSteps

        public abstract void addSteps(ParallelScriptBuilder parallelSteps)
        Add a parallel series of steps to this builder. Since the behavior of this depends on the current step, please see a more specific step addition behavior descriptions here: SequentialScriptBuilder.addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder) and ParallelScriptBuilder.addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder).
        Parameters:
        parallelSteps - Script steps to be added to this builder

      • addSteps

        public void addSteps(AbstractScriptBuilder scriptBuilder)
        Adds steps for an unknown builder type. This does instance of checks and defers to either addSteps(ParallelScriptBuilder) or addSteps(SequentialScriptBuilder).
        Parameters:
        scriptBuilder - Script builder to add steps from

      • getMaximumNeededThreadCount

        public int getMaximumNeededThreadCount()
        Call to check how many threads this script will need to execute at the current build point. This can give you an idea of how intensely parallel this script is. Though it should be known that less threads may be started than this. If the rate limiting is being used, depending on how fast test steps are completing not all threads may be used.
        Returns:
        Number of threads to run script at it's most parallel point

      • makeCopy

        public abstract AbstractScriptBuilder makeCopy()
        Make a copy of the script chain. This is necessary if you want to add the chain multiple times to another chain. The returned chain will execute the same script step instances (so if added to a parallel builder make sure the script steps are thread safe).
        Returns:
        A copy builder

      • build

        public ExecutableScript build()
        Finalizes the script and compiles into an executable form.
        Returns:
        A script which can be started
